item.title: Ticket #742 (feed and trackback links broken for pages) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #742 (feed and trackback links broken for pages) created
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
trackback_url and comments_rss_link append trackback/ and feed/ to the permalink. For pages this generates something like domain/page-name/feed/

However, the default rewrite rules in .htaccess cannot handle such URLs.

item.title: Ticket #741 (title not updated in permalink after change) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: This is by design. Permalinks that change aren't permalinks. If you must change it, the page slug can be edited manually. Or, if you blank the slug, it will be regenerated.

item.title: Ticket #741 (title not updated in permalink after change) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #741 (title not updated in permalink after change) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: When you write something, with eg mod rewrite having the name of the title in the permalink, this permalink is not updated when you alter the title. this matters eg when you write an error in the title, and don't won't to have the permalink point forever to this mistake.

D

item.dc:creator: mcnicks
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #740 ('write page' does not save menu_order) created
item.dc:creator: mcnicks
item.description: When you specify a value in the 'Page order' field during the creation of a new page, the value does not get saved.

item.title: Ticket #739 (View by days doesn't work) updated
item.dc:creator: Technosailor
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #739 (View by days doesn't work) created
item.dc:creator: Technosailor
item.description: When admin sets Options > Reading to view posts last x days, WP displays ALL posts (in my case back to May 19, 2004). Function works as expected when viewing x number of posts.

item.description:

Ozh

item.title: Ticket #738 ([patch] rss 1.1 support) updated
item.dc:creator: Albert
item.description: Diffed wrong files when creating rss1.1.updates.diff. Can not remove it for some reason. rss1.1.updates.2.diff contains the proper updates to existing files.

item.title: Ticket #738 ([patch] rss 1.1 support) updated
item.dc:creator: Albert
item.description: The file wp-rss11.php contains the full rss 1.1 template. Author: ​http://inamidst.com/rss1.1/apps.html#Wordpress (probably Christopher Schmidt).

item.title: Ticket #738 ([patch] rss 1.1 support) updated
item.dc:creator: Albert
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #738 ([patch] rss 1.1 support) created
item.dc:creator: Albert
item.description:
​http://inamidst.com/rss1.1/ is an initial draft for a content syndication format that updates RSS 1.0.

​http://inamidst.com/rss1.1/apps.html#Wordpress contains instructions and code/templates. The following patch rss1.1.updates.diff contains the differences to existing files in the repository.

item.title: Ticket #737 ([patch] human-time-diff special case for first minute) updated
item.dc:creator: Albert
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #737 ([patch] human-time-diff special case for first minute) created
item.dc:creator: Albert
item.description:
human-time-diff got special cases that manages the first hour and first day by using '1 day' and '% days' and similar. For minutes, there is no such special case, giving the output '1 mins' for the case of the first minute.

Even though this will rarely happend, I believe it would be nice to handle it.

item.title: Changeset [2118]: More escaping of description and cleaner default feed URIs.
item.dc:creator: saxmatt
item.description: More escaping of description and cleaner default feed URIs.

item.title: Ticket #736 (Thumbnail images low quality) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #736 (Thumbnail images low quality) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I and others don't like the way thumbnails are 256 colors or some really grainy image...

this is what I did to fix it:

Change the line in the file admin-functions.php from :

@imagecopyresized ($thumbnail, $image, 0, 0, 0, 0, $image_new_width, $image_new_height, $image_attr[0], $image_attr[1]);

to

@imagecopyresampled ($thumbnail, $image, 0, 0, 0, 0, $image_new_width, $image_new_height, $image_attr[0], $image_attr[1]);

"imagecopyresampled" does a LOT better job than " imagecopyresized "

Hope this works + helps!

I was also having problems with thumbnail quality and didn't like the switch from MT to wordpress for that reason. Maybe this can get in a new update.

--Kevin kevin@…
